remarks.format: ## Remarks 泛型类提供从一组键到一组值的映射。The generic class provides a mapping from a set of keys to a set of values. 每次对字典的添加都包含一个值和与其关联的键。Each addition to the dictionary consists of a value and its associated key. 通过键来检索一个值是非常快，关闭到 o （1），因为类实现为哈希表。Retrieving a value by using its key is very fast, close to O(1), because the class is implemented as a hash table. > [!NOTE] > 检索的速度取决于为指定的类型的哈希算法的质量`TKey`。The speed of retrieval depends on the quality of the hashing algorithm of the type specified for `TKey`. 只要使用对象作为一个密钥，不得更改任何方式影响其哈希值。As long as an object is used as a key in the , it must not change in any way that affects its hash value. 中的所有密钥必须是唯一根据字典的相等性比较器。Every key in a must be unique according to the dictionary's equality comparer. 密钥不能`null`，但值则可以为，如果类型值`TValue`是引用类型。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be, if the value type `TValue` is a reference type. 需要一个相等实现来确定键是否相等。 requires an equality implementation to determine whether keys are equal. 您可以指定的实现泛型接口使用的构造函数接受`comparer`参数; 如果未指定，默认泛型相等比较器实现使用。You can specify an implementation of the generic interface by using a constructor that accepts a `comparer` parameter; if you do not specify an implementation, the default generic equality comparer is used. 如果类型`TKey`实现泛型接口的默认相等比较器使用该实现。If type `TKey` implements the generic interface, the default equality comparer uses that implementation. > [!NOTE] > 例如，可以使用所提供的不区分大小写的字符串比较器类来创建具有不区分大小写的字符串键的字典。For example, you can use the case-insensitive string comparers provided by the class to create dictionaries with case-insensitive string keys. 容量是元素数目可以容纳。The capacity of a is the number of elements the can hold. 元素添加到，自动增加容量所要求的重新分配内部数组。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. 对于非常大对象，可以通过设置增加到 20 亿元素在 64 位系统上的最大容量`enabled`到的配置元素的特性`true`在运行时环境中。For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. 对于枚举而言，字典中的每个项都会被视为结构，它表示包含值和其键。For purposes of enumeration, each item in the remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于枚举而言，每个项都是结构，它表示包含值和其键。For purposes of enumeration, each item is a structure representing a value and its key. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。You must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回的相同元素直到调用方法。The property returns the same element until the method is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

C# 语言使用关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. remarks.format: ## Remarks 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这可能会导致枚举器引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which can cause the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 属性返回一个对象，可用于同步对。The property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 同步是所有线程访问集合之前都锁定的对象时才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock the object before accessing the collection. 获取此属性的值是 o （1） 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素不存在的键的值设置在字典中; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法将引发异常，如果指定的键已存在。In contrast, the method throws an exception if the specified key already exists. 如果小于的 o （1） 运算接近容量，此方法。If is less than the capacity, this method approaches an O(1) operation. 如果需要增加以容纳新元素的容量，此方法将成为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。If the capacity needs to be increased to accommodate the new element, this method becomes an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何访问类通过接口。The following code example shows how to access the class through the interface. 代码示例创建一个空的字符串与字符串键，并使用方法来添加一些元素。The code example creates an empty of strings with string keys and uses the method to add some elements. 该示例演示方法会抛出时尝试添加重复的键，或提供的密钥或错误的数据类型的值时。The example demonstrates that the method throws an when attempting to add a duplicate key, or when a key or value of the wrong data type is supplied. 代码示例演示如何将多个其他成员的接口。The code example demonstrates the use of several other members of the interface. remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于枚举而言，每个项都是结构。For purposes of enumeration, each item is a structure. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 方法也会枚举数放回此位置。The method also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一个元素之前或调用方法。The property returns the same element until either the or method is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何通过使用枚举字典中的键/值对`foreach`语句 (`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中`for each`c + + 中)，从而隐藏了枚举器的使用。The following code example shows how to enumerate the key/value pairs in the dictionary by using the `foreach` statement (`For Each` in Visual Basic, `for each` in C++), which hides the use of the enumerator. 具体而言，请注意，枚举数接口返回对象而非对象。In particular, note that the enumerator for the interface returns objects rather than objects. 代码示例摘自一个更大的示例，包括输出中，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合只是一个集合与防止添加和移除元素; 的包装器因此，如果在更改基础集合，包括添加或删除的元素，大小固定集合反映了这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 获取此属性的值是 o （1） 操作。Getting the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性，可以通过使用下面的 C# 语法访问集合中的特定值： `myCollection[key]` (`myCollection(key)`在 Visual Basic 中)。This property provides the ability to access a specific value in the collection by using the following C# syntax: `myCollection[key]` (`myCollection(key)` in Visual Basic). 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素不存在的键的值设置在字典中; 例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果在字典中已存在指定的键，则将设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 使用 C# 语言[这](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the [this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 获取或设置此属性的值接近 o （1） 操作。Getting or setting the value of this property approaches an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用的属性 （C# 中的索引器）与，以及方法的属性不同于属性。The following code example shows how to use the property (the indexer in C#) of the interface with a , and ways the property differs from the property. 该示例表明，，喜欢属性，属性可以更改与现有密钥关联的值，可以使用指定的键是否不在字典中添加新的键/值对。The example shows that, like the property, the property can change the value associated with an existing key and can be used to add a new key/value pair if the specified key is not in the dictionary. 该示例还表明，与不同属性，属性不会引发异常，如果`key`未在字典中返回空引用改为。The example also shows that unlike the property, the property does not throw an exception if `key` is not in the dictionary, returning a null reference instead. 最后，该示例演示获取属性返回空引用，如果`key`不是正确的数据类型，并设置该属性将引发异常，如果`key`不正确的数据类型。Finally, the example demonstrates that getting the property returns a null reference if `key` is not the correct data type, and that setting the property throws an exception if `key` is not the correct data type. 代码示例摘自一个更大的示例，包括输出中，为提供方法。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. returns.span: 可用于循环访问集合的 。

span.span: An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 方法也会枚举数放回此位置。The method also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义属性。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一个元素之前或调用方法。The property returns the same element until either the or method is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 该枚举数不具有独占访问集合的权限；因此，枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将的功能组合方法和属性。This method combines the functionality of the method and the property. 如果未找到键，则 `value` 参数将为类型 `TValue` 获取适当的默认值；例如，为整数类型获取 0（零），为布尔值类型获取 `false`，为引用类型获取 `null`。If the key is not found, then the `value` parameter gets the appropriate default value for the type `TValue`; for example, 0 (zero) for integer types, `false` for Boolean types, and `null` for reference types. 使用方法如果你的代码经常尝试访问不在字典中的密钥。Use the method if your code frequently attempts to access keys that are not in the dictionary. 使用此方法是比捕获更高效引发的属性。Using this method is more efficient than catching the thrown by the property. 此方法会接近 o （1） 操作。This method approaches an O(1) operation. ## Examples 该示例演示如何使用方法作为更高效的方法来检索经常尝试不在字典中的键的程序中的值。The example shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values in a program that frequently tries keys that are not in the dictionary. 与之相反，对于该示例还演示如何将属性 （C# 中的索引器） 在尝试检索不存在的键时引发异常。For contrast, the example also shows how the property (the indexer in C#) throws exceptions when attempting to retrieve nonexistent keys. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类 (`openWith`是此示例中使用的字典的名称)。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class (`openWith` is the name of the Dictionary used in this example).
